description: This module examines the process of narrative construction and narration in relation to an 'auteur' approach that considers film authorship in terms of a director's 'signature style'. Through close analysis of the work of three different directors, we will: 1) explore the relationship between form, ideology and narrative, and the influence of the socio-cultural context on storytelling and meaning making; 2) pursue and evaluate the auteur theory - Who is an author, specifically in film, where teamwork is everything? What makes a director an auteur? What cultural and/or ideological implications reside in the development, alteration or evolution of an auteur's style?
title: Narrative, Narration, Auteur
